dublin_core.dcvalue: This paper describes an approach to building a high quality mobile telemedicine system that overcomes the limitations of individual public wireless data networks Public wireless data channels do not have the capacity to handle the high bandwidth video needed for applications such as remote evaluation of trauma and stroke patients Network striping allows us to aggregate multiple physical channels to meet the bandwidth requirements for the video We have developed flexible network striping software middleware and are building a telemedicine system using that middleware Our approach uses existing communications infrastructure and conventional off the shelf components making the system easy to deploy
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:24:38Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2007-02-06
Conference proceedings : ... Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. Annual Conference
Building a High-Quality Mobile Telemedicine System using Network Striping over Dissimilar Wireless Wide Area Networks.
